wekabci.server
Class WekaThread

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      wekabci.server.WekaThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class WekaThread
extends java.lang.Thread

This class manages each connection that is created by the Weka server. One thread is created by each new client that connects to the server. This thread has a Protocol that processess all the messages that come from the client, and manages important state changes.

Author:
villalon

public double classifyInstance(weka.core.Instance instance)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Classifies an instance using the classifier that was previously set according to the protocol in this particular communication thread.

Parameters:

Returns:
the output from the classifier (the predicted class)

getInstancesFromAttributeList

private weka.core.Instances getInstancesFromAttributeList(java.lang.String name,
                                                          java.lang.String list)
Gets a structure for Instances from a list of attributes coming from a semicolon separated list. This list and name should come as a result of a SAVE message from the client. It adds a final attribute called "class" which represents the value to predict.

Parameters:
name - The name of the dataset (usually the subject, session and run)
list - A semicolon separated list of attribute names
Returns:
Weka Instances with the structure

public boolean isListening()
If the thread is listening for messages

Returns:

isSaveTrainingFile

public boolean isSaveTrainingFile()
If the thread is in save file for training mode. If it is the case, the thread will save all the values coming from the client as instances of a Weka dataset.

Returns:

run

public void run()
The running of the thread, this is called every time a new client connects to the WekaServer.
